definition: to start sth new or original (idiom); to break a new path/to break fresh ground
to leave/to depart/to separate/to distinguish/to classify/other/another/don't ...!/to pin/to stick (sth) in
to make sb change their ways, opinions etc

to open/to start/to turn on/to boil/to write out (a prescription, check, invoice etc)/to operate (a vehicle)/carat (gold)/abbr. for Kelvin, 開爾文|开尔文[Kai1 er3 wen2]/abbr. for 開本|开本[kai1 ben3], book format
to be born/to give birth/life/to grow/raw/uncooked/student
flour/noodles/(of food) soft (not crunchy)/(slang) (of a person) ineffectual/spineless
face/side/surface/aspect/top/classifier for flat surfaces such as drums, mirrors, flags etc

sentences.english: This suggestion is new, and out of the common road.
sentences.chinese: 这个建议是新的，而且是别开生面的。

sentences.english: This is a unique "water entrance ceremony."
sentences.chinese: 这是一场别开生面的“水上入场式”。

sentences.english: His method of study was characteristic.
sentences.chinese: 他的学习方法是别开生面的。

sentences.english: Based on this, the thesis reviews Foucaults inimitable conception of power.
sentences.chinese: 在此基础上，考察了福柯别开生面的权力观。

sentences.english: Camel racing was held last Sunday in Berlin, capital of Germany.
sentences.chinese: 德国柏林25日举行了一场别开生面的骆驼竞技大赛。

sentences.english: Xu Wei's"freehand ink"painting techniques for the bird, spectacular dreams of.
sentences.chinese: 徐渭的泼墨写意花鸟画，别开生面自成一家。

definition: to hit on sth new (idiom); to display originality/to adopt an original approach
having a unique or distinctive style
great meal fit for dragon's son (idiom); sumptuous banquet
a pleasant change/a breath of fresh air/refreshing
each new high point replaced by another/(of a movie etc) one climax after another
